title: Xiaomi becomes second-largest smartphone vendor in India in Q4 2016
text:
Xiaomi becomes second-largest smartphone vendor in India in Q4 2016 Xiaomi becomes second-largest smartphone vendor in India in Q4 2016   “Xiaomi claims to have sold over three million Redmi 3S series phones in six months” 
Citing the research firm IDC’s report, Xiaomi has announced it’s position as the second-largest smartphone vendor in India in Q4 2016. The company claims to have sold more than three million units of the Redmi 3S series smartphones including the Redmi 3S , Redmi 3S Prime and Redmi 3S Plus in less than six months. 
Xiaomi said that the unprecedented success of the Redmi 3S series contributed majorly to its growth in Q4 2016. The company maintained the number one position in the country in the online smartphone market in the same period. The brand also expanded its presence in the offline market with the launch of the Redmi 3S Plus exclusively for offline channels in the same quarter. 
According to IDC’s India Quarterly Smartphone Tracker – February 2017 Release, “Xiaomi climbed up to 2nd place with 10.7 percent share in CY Q4 2016 against 3.3 percent share in the same period last year. Year-on-year shipments grew threefold while sequential growth was 15.3 percent in CY Q4 2016.” 
After entering India in July 2014, Xiaomi crossed the $1 billion revenue mark in the country last year. Apart from online sales, the company is now selling its devices through 8,500 multi-brand stores across the country. It is also gradually expanding its offline presence in the country.
